meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -

Alright, folks! Let's get this review party started!

Lords of the Fallen is the latest soulslike game to hit the streets, and boy, does it deliver on some fronts. But before we dive in, let me just say that I'm thrilled to be reviewing this game without the pesky problem of needing a flowchart to understand what's going on (looking at you, Dark Souls).

So, what's the fuss all about? Well, for starters, Lords of the Fallen has some top-notch world-building and aesthetics. The environments are a treat for the eyes, with lush forests, crumbling ruins, and mysterious caves just begging to be explored. And let me tell you, exploring is where this game shines! You'll find yourself getting lost in the nooks and crannies of these fantastical worlds, uncovering hidden secrets and taking down baddies left and right.

But, as with any good soulslike game, combat is king. And boy, does Lords of the Fallen deliver on that front too! The action is fast-paced, intense, and satisfyingly brutal. I mean, where else can you slash and hack your way through hordes of demonic creatures, and still feel like a boss?

Now, about those technical issues... Yeah, let's just say that some folks have been having a few problems with the game. But hey, at least it's not as bad as some other games out there (cough, cough, Cyberpunk 2077). And who knows? Maybe all the patches will iron out the kinks in due time.

But what really gets me excited about Lords of the Fallen is its willingness to take risks and try new things. I mean, swapping between two versions of the world to solve puzzles and slay enemies? Genius! It's like playing a whole different game within a game! And that buildcrafting system? Forget about it! You'll be crafting your way to victory in no time.

All in all, Lords of the Fallen is a solid addition to the soulslike genre. Sure, it may not be perfect, but who is? It's got heart, it's got humor, and it's got some of the most epic boss battles I've ever seen.

So, if you're looking for a game that'll keep you on your toes and make you feel like a total bad-ass, Lords of the Fallen might just be the ticket. Just don't forget to save frequently...
